meanings.definition: To absorb or soak up liquid
meanings.sent1: The sponge was sponging up the spilled milk.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys sponging the excess water from the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent3: The thirsty sponge was sponging up the juice like a superhero.
meanings.sent4: The desert sand sponges up any moisture like a sponge.
meanings.sent5: The sponge sponging the rainwater made a squishing sound.

meanings.definition: To obtain something without paying for it
meanings.sent1: He was sponging free samples at the store.
meanings.sent2: She was sponging extra ketchup packets from the fast-food restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon was sponging snacks from the campers' bags.
meanings.sent4: The student sponged knowledge from the library books.
meanings.sent5: The cat sponging attention from everyone in the room.

meanings.definition: A person who habitually relies on others for support or favors
meanings.sent1: The sponging friend always asks for money but never pays back.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a sponging burden on her family during tough times.
meanings.sent3: The sponging roommate never buys groceries and eats everyone else's food.
meanings.sent4: The sponging coworker constantly seeks help but never offers any in return.
meanings.sent5: The sponging relative always shows up for free meals at family gatherings.
